alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Van Buren; Warren (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 01 at 10:21PM CST until March 02 at 5:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Coffee, Grundy, Van Buren and Warren. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McMinnville, Manchester, Spencer, Tullahoma, Gruetli-Laager, Tracy City, Altamont, Coalmont, Morrison, Palmer, Beersheba Springs, Viola, Pelham, Hillsboro and Summitville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
